message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.GR, cs.SC. 

The paper deals with the problem of reconstructing geometric objects using probing devices, which is a topic in computational geometry (cs.CG). The use of algorithms to minimize the number of probes required suggests a connection to data structures (cs.DS) and discrete mathematics (cs.DM). The problem of determining the shape and orientation of a convex polygon also involves graph theory (cs.GR) and computational science (cs.SC).
